SoftwareEngineer.htmlContent:
SoftwareEngineer

Requirement

Job Description

A software engineer designs, develops, tests, and maintains computer software, collaborating with teams to translate user needs into functional and robust applications and systems.

Core Responsibilities:

  1. Design and Development
  2. Testing and Quality Assurance
  3. Maintenance and Support
  4. Collaboration and Communication
  5. Problem Solving
  6. Documentation

Skills and Responsibilities

  1. Technical Skills:
    • Proficiency in one or more programming languages (e.g., Java, Python, C++, JavaScript).
    • Knowledge of software development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall).
    • Understanding of data structures and algorithms.
    • Experience with databases and cloud technologies.
  2. Soft Skills:
    • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
    • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
    • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
    • Attention to detail and a commitment to quality.

Eligibility:

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree:

    A bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field (like information technology or mathematics) is generally required.

  • Master's Degree (Optional):

    Some employers may prefer or require a master's degree, especially for more specialized or senior roles.

  • Alternative Paths:

    While a traditional degree is common, some individuals can gain the necessary skills through coding bootcamps or other intensive training programs.

Resume Link

apply here

Roadmap

You will receive a call from HR if your resume gets selected. HR will confirm everything and assist you for the further process.

3 rounds of Interview

  1. Technical Round:

      Technical interviews go beyond testing your coding or problem-solving skills.

    • medium: quiz
    • top 10 questions commonly asked: click here
  2. Interview With Team Leader
    • F2F convo
    • more detailed
    • level: moderate to high
  3. Manager Round

    4. In the managerial round, they mainly evaluate your working style, how you interact with a team, and how you react to scenarios that are likely to arise while you are working for their company on a daily basis.

    • level: high

You will receive selection email and call from company in few days if pass all the rounds

DataAnalyst.htmlContent:
data analyst

Requirement

Job Description

A data analyst collects, processes, and analyzes data to help organizations make informed decisions. They use statistical tools to identify trends and provide actionable insights.

Core Responsibilities:

  1. Data Collection and Cleaning
  2. Statistical Analysis
  3. Reporting and Visualization
  4. Database Management
  5. Data-Driven Decision Making
  6. Stakeholder Communication

Skills and Responsibilities

  1. Technical Skills:
    • Proficiency in Excel, SQL, and Python or R
    • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
    • Strong understanding of statistics and data modeling
    • Familiarity with databases and data warehousing concepts
  2. Soft Skills:
    • Analytical and problem-solving abilities
    • Communication and storytelling with data
    • Attention to detail
    • Teamwork and adaptability

Eligibility:

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree:

    In statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related fields.

  • Certifications (Optional):

    Courses like Google Data Analytics, Microsoft Certified Data Analyst, etc.

Resume Link

apply here

Roadmap

You will receive a call from HR if your resume is selected. HR will guide you through the next steps.

3 rounds of Interview

  1. Technical Round:

      Focuses on your analytical thinking, SQL queries, Excel tasks, and case studies.

    • medium: online test or quiz
    • sample questions: click here
  2. Case Study + Team Interview
    • Panel-based problem-solving round
    • level: moderate to high
  3. Managerial Round

    4. Assesses communication, decision-making under pressure, and cultural fit.

    • level: high

You will receive a selection email and call from the company if you pass all rounds.

CloudEngineer.htmlContent:
Cloud engineer

Requirement

Job Description

A cloud engineer is responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining cloud computing infrastructure. They work on deploying applications, managing cloud resources, and ensuring scalability and security.

Core Responsibilities:

  1. Cloud Architecture Design
  2. Deployment and Monitoring
  3. Security and Compliance
  4. Performance Optimization
  5. Automation and Scripting
  6. Troubleshooting and Support

Skills and Responsibilities

  1. Technical Skills:
    • Proficiency in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)
    • Knowledge of networking, virtualization, and Linux
    • Experience with automation tools like Terraform, Ansible
    • Familiarity with DevOps and CI/CD practices
  2. Soft Skills:
    • Strong analytical and troubleshooting abilities
    • Good communication and documentation skills
    • Team collaboration and adaptability
    • Quick learning and staying updated with cloud trends

Eligibility:

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree:

    In computer science, IT, or related technical fields

  • Certifications (Recommended):

    AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Microsoft Azure Administrator, Google Associate Cloud Engineer

Resume Link

apply here

Roadmap

If your resume is shortlisted, HR will reach out to guide you through the interview process.

3 rounds of Interview

  1. Technical Round:

      Focus on cloud concepts, tools, deployment strategies, and scenario-based questions.

    • medium: quiz or hands-on test
    • sample questions: click here
  2. Architectural Design Round
    • Design a scalable, secure cloud solution
    • level: moderate to high
  3. Managerial Round

    4. Tests how you handle stress, make decisions, and work in a team with deadlines.

    • level: high

If selected, you will receive confirmation via email and call within a few days.

cyberSecurity.htmlContent:
Cyber Security

Requirement

Job Description

A Cyber Security professional protects an organizationâ€™s computer systems and networks from cyber threats such as hacking, viruses, and data breaches. They implement security measures, monitor for vulnerabilities, and respond to incidents.

Core Responsibilities:

  1. Monitoring and Managing Security Systems
  2. Risk Assessment and Mitigation
  3. Incident Response and Recovery
  4. Security Policy Implementation
  5. Penetration Testing and Vulnerability Assessments
  6. Security Awareness Training

Skills and Responsibilities

  1. Technical Skills:
    • Knowledge of firewalls, VPNs, IDS/IPS, and anti-virus software
    • Understanding of encryption, authentication, and network protocols
    • Familiarity with security tools (e.g., Wireshark, Nmap, Metasploit)
    • Understanding of cybersecurity frameworks (e.g., NIST, ISO/IEC 27001)
  2. Soft Skills:
    • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
    • Good communication and attention to detail
    • Ability to remain calm under pressure during incidents
    • Teamwork and ethical mindset

Eligibility:

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree:

    In computer science, information security, or a related field

  • Certifications (Highly Valued):

    CompTIA Security+, CEH (Certified Ethical Hacker), CISSP, CISM

Resume Link

apply here

Roadmap

If your resume meets the criteria, HR will initiate the further interview process.

3 rounds of Interview

  1. Technical Round:

      Focus on security fundamentals, encryption, attack scenarios, and defense mechanisms.

    • medium: technical quiz or Q&A
    • common questions: click here
  2. Practical Round
    • Hands-on or theoretical case analysis: how to secure a system or react to an incident
    • level: high
  3. Managerial Round

    4. Assessment of decision-making, stress-handling, and ethical responsibility in security roles.

    • level: high

HR will contact you regarding your selection via email or phone if you clear all rounds.

ProductManager.htmlContent:
Product Manager

Requirement

Job Description

A Product Manager oversees the development and delivery of products, ensuring they meet user needs and align with business goals. They act as a bridge between cross-functional teams like engineering, design, marketing, and sales.

Core Responsibilities:

  1. Product Strategy and Vision
  2. Roadmap Planning
  3. Market and User Research
  4. Cross-functional Team Coordination
  5. Feature Prioritization and Backlog Management
  6. Measuring Product Performance and Success

Skills and Responsibilities

  1. Technical/Domain Knowledge:
    • Understanding of software development lifecycle
    • Data analysis and market research skills
    • Experience with product management tools (e.g., JIRA, Trello, Asana)
  2. Soft Skills:
    • Strong leadership and communication skills
    • Ability to prioritize and make decisions under pressure
    • Customer-centric mindset
    • Collaboration and empathy for all stakeholders

Eligibility:

Education:

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree:

    In business, engineering, computer science, or a related field

  • MBA (Optional but Preferred):

    Especially useful for senior-level roles and strategic positions

  • Certifications (Optional):

    Product Management certifications (e.g., Pragmatic, AIPMM, General Assembly)

Resume Link

apply here

Roadmap

If your resume matches the expectations, HR will reach out and schedule your interviews.

3 rounds of Interview

  1. Product Thinking Round:

      Assesses your understanding of product development, customer needs, and decision-making.

    • medium: case studies or scenario questions
    • practice material: click here
  2. Execution & Strategy Round
    • Focuses on roadmap planning, metrics, and managing product releases
    • level: moderate to high
  3. Managerial/Stakeholder Round

    4. This evaluates collaboration skills, conflict resolution, and alignment with the company's vision.

    • level: high

Selected candidates will be contacted by HR via phone or email for offer discussions.

uxUiDesigner.htmlContent:
UX/UI Designer

Requirement

Job Description

A UX/UI Designer is responsible for enhancing user satisfaction by improving the usability, accessibility, and overall experience of a digital product. They focus on the look and feel of the product while ensuring it is intuitive and user-friendly.

Core Responsibilities:

  1. Conducting user research and testing
  2. Creating wireframes, prototypes, and user flows
  3. Designing user interfaces (UI) aligned with brand identity
  4. Collaborating with developers and product teams
  5. Iterating based on feedback and analytics

Skills and Responsibilities

  1. Technical/Design Skills:
    • Proficiency in tools like Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, Illustrator
    • Knowledge of HTML/CSS is a plus
    • Strong grasp of user-centered design principles
  2. Soft Skills:
    • Empathy and attention to detail
    • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities
    • Critical thinking and problem-solving

Eligibility:

Education:

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree:

    In design, human-computer interaction (HCI), computer science, or a related field

  • Certification Courses:

    UX/UI design bootcamps or online certifications (Coursera, Google UX Design, etc.)

  • Portfolio:

    Required â€“ must demonstrate your design thinking and past work clearly

Resume Link

apply here

Roadmap

After reviewing your resume and portfolio, HR will reach out to schedule your interviews.

3 rounds of Interview

  1. Design Assignment / Portfolio Review:

      Youâ€™ll be asked to present your portfolio and may be given a short assignment.

    • medium: online submission or discussion
    • helpful resources: click here
  2. Technical/Design Thinking Round
    • Focuses on your approach to solving design problems, usability, and feedback incorporation
    • level: moderate
  3. Managerial/Team Collaboration Round

    4. This assesses how well you work within a team, communicate with developers, and align with business goals.

    • level: moderate to high

HR will send a confirmation and next steps via email or phone if selected.

TechnicalSupportEngineer.htmlContent:
Technical Support Engineer

Requirement

Job Description

A Technical Support Engineer provides technical assistance to customers or internal teams. They troubleshoot software, hardware, or network-related issues and ensure smooth technical operations.

Core Responsibilities:

  1. Diagnosing and resolving technical issues
  2. Responding to customer queries via phone, email, or chat
  3. Documenting issues and solutions
  4. Collaborating with engineering or product teams for unresolved problems
  5. Providing product knowledge and training to users

Skills and Responsibilities

  1. Technical Skills:
    • Understanding of operating systems (Windows, Linux, macOS)
    • Basic networking knowledge (IP, DNS, VPN)
    • Familiarity with troubleshooting tools and techniques
    • Experience with ticketing systems (e.g., Zendesk, Jira)
  2. Soft Skills:
    • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
    • Patience and empathy
    • Time management and multitasking abilities
    • Problem-solving and logical thinking

Eligibility:

Education:

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree:

    In computer science, information technology, electronics, or related fields

  • Certifications (optional but preferred):

    CompTIA A+, ITIL, or Microsoft Certified Support Technician (MCST)

  • Experience with customer service or internships is a plus

Resume Link

apply here

Roadmap

Once your resume is shortlisted, HR will reach out to initiate the process and explain the interview format.

3 rounds of Interview

  1. Technical Assessment:

      Basic troubleshooting scenarios, technical MCQs, and customer support simulations

    • medium: online quiz or live call
    • sample questions: click here
  2. Scenario-Based Interview
    • Real-time problem-solving and communication tests
    • level: moderate
  3. Managerial Round

    4. Discussion on handling pressure, user communication, prioritization, and escalation protocols

    • level: moderate to high

If selected, an offer letter and joining formalities will be shared by HR within a few working days.

DevOpsEngineer.htmlContent:
DevOps Engineer

Requirement

Job Description

A DevOps Engineer bridges the gap between development and operations by automating processes, improving system reliability, and ensuring rapid and safe software deployment.

Core Responsibilities:

  1. Automation of infrastructure and deployment processes
  2. Monitoring and maintaining system health and uptime
  3. CI/CD pipeline setup and management
  4. Collaboration with development and IT teams
  5. Managing cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP)
  6. Ensuring security and compliance in deployments

Skills and Responsibilities

  1. Technical Skills:
    • Experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI)
    • Knowledge of containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
    • Understanding of cloud platforms and infrastructure as code (Terraform, CloudFormation)
    • Proficiency in scripting languages (Bash, Python, PowerShell)
  2. Soft Skills:
    • Analytical and problem-solving mindset
    • Team collaboration and communication skills
    • Attention to detail
    • Adaptability to fast-changing environments

Eligibility:

Education:

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree:

    In computer science, information technology, or a related technical field

  • Certifications (preferred):

    AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Docker Certified Associate, Kubernetes Certification (CKA/CKAD)

  • Experience in system administration or software engineering roles is a plus

Resume Link

apply here

Roadmap

Upon resume selection, HR will initiate the hiring process and coordinate interviews.

3 rounds of Interview

  1. Technical Round:

      Focus on tools knowledge, system design, and hands-on problem-solving (e.g., configuring a pipeline or debugging deployment)

    • medium: quiz or live coding round
    • top questions: click here
  2. Practical Assessment
    • Task-oriented round â€” may include cloud setup, scripting, CI/CD pipeline creation
    • level: high
  3. Managerial Round

    4. Assessment of communication, delivery under pressure, and DevOps culture fit

    • level: high

Final selection will be followed by email and call from HR with offer details and onboarding steps.

aiMlEngineer.htmlContent:
AI/ML Engineer

Requirement

Job Description

An AI/ML Engineer builds intelligent algorithms and models that enable machines to learn and make predictions or decisions based on data. They work closely with data scientists and software developers to bring AI applications to life.

Core Responsibilities:

  1. Designing and developing machine learning models
  2. Training, testing, and tuning algorithms
  3. Data preprocessing and feature engineering
  4. Deploying ML models into production
  5. Research and development in AI techniques
  6. Collaborating with cross-functional teams

Skills and Responsibilities

  1. Technical Skills:
    • Strong knowledge of Python, R, or Java
    • Experience with ML libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn
    • Understanding of algorithms, data structures, statistics, and linear algebra
    • Working knowledge of data handling tools (NumPy, Pandas), and cloud ML services
    • Familiarity with MLOps practices is a plus
  2. Soft Skills:
    • Problem-solving and logical thinking
    • Research and experimentation mindset
    • Communication and teamwork skills
    • Curiosity and a continuous learning attitude

Eligibility:

Education:

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree:

    In Computer Science, Data Science, AI/ML, or related field

  • Masterâ€™s or PhD (Preferred):

    Especially for research-heavy or advanced model development roles

  • Online Certifications:

    Google AI, IBM ML, DeepLearning.AI Specialization, etc. are a plus

Resume Link

apply here

Roadmap

Once your resume is shortlisted, HR will initiate contact and guide you through the interview process.

3 rounds of Interview

  1. Technical Round:

      Expect questions on ML concepts, model tuning, overfitting/underfitting, as well as coding tasks related to data cleaning or model implementation

    • medium: online test + interview
    • sample questions: click here
  2. Use-Case or Project Discussion
    • Discussion on your past ML projects or a case study evaluation
    • level: moderate to high
  3. Managerial Round

    4. Assesses your understanding of real-world application of ML, timelines, and working with stakeholders

    • level: high

Successful candidates will be notified via email and call regarding the next steps and offer details.

BusinessAnalyst.htmlContent:
Business Analyst

Requirement

Job Description

A Business Analyst bridges the gap between business needs and technology solutions by analyzing processes, gathering requirements, and proposing data-driven improvements that enhance organizational efficiency.

Core Responsibilities:

  1. Gathering and analyzing business requirements
  2. Creating documentation such as BRDs, FRDs, and flowcharts
  3. Working with stakeholders to identify opportunities for improvement
  4. Performing data analysis to support decision-making
  5. Coordinating with development and QA teams to implement solutions
  6. Evaluating project outcomes and delivering reports

Skills and Responsibilities

  1. Technical/Analytical Skills:
    • Proficiency in tools like Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI
    • Understanding of data modeling and database concepts
    • Knowledge of business process modeling techniques (BPMN/UML)
    • Experience with requirement gathering and use-case documentation
  2. Soft Skills:
    • Critical thinking and problem-solving
    • Effective communication and negotiation
    • Stakeholder management and interpersonal skills
    • Time management and adaptability

Eligibility:

Education:

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree:

    In Business Administration, Computer Science, Economics, or related field

  • Certifications (Preferred):

    CBAP, CCBA, PMI-PBA, or similar business analysis certifications

  • Internship or Industry Experience:

    Exposure to real-world projects can enhance your profile

Resume Link

apply here

Roadmap

Once your resume is shortlisted, the HR team will reach out to schedule the interviews and provide guidance on next steps.

3 rounds of Interview

  1. Aptitude/Technical Round:

      Tests your logical reasoning, basic business concepts, and sometimes tools like Excel or SQL

    • medium: quiz/test
    • sample questions: click here
  2. Business Case Discussion
    • Analyze a scenario or past business problem and suggest improvements
    • level: moderate
  3. Managerial Round

    4. Assesses your ability to handle client communication, conflicting priorities, and real-world business problem-solving.

    • level: high

You will receive an email and a call with the results and further onboarding details if selected.
